alert.note: Alert for Extreme Western Allegany; Garrett (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 15 at 2:04AM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...Lingering Snow Showers and Slick Spots Through Early Morning... Occasional snow showers will affect locations along the Allegheny Front, particularly in western Grant, western Pendleton, and Garrett counties. Additional accumulations around one to two inches are likely. Temperatures will remain in the upper teens to lower 20s with northwest wind gusts around 25 to 35 mph. The combination of snow showers and strong winds mean that there will be areas of blowing snow that reduce visibility below one-half mile at times. Be prepared for sudden changes in visibility when driving along with snow covered and slippery surfaces.
